Class Shooter

  • java.lang.Object
    • DefaultCritter
      • Shooter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Critter

    public class Shooter
extends DefaultCritter
    A class that extends DefaultCritter and serves as a model object for a shooter with a barrel that can rotate and that can shoot different types of missiles
    Author:
    Bradley Fourie, Daniel Banks, Heinrich Benz
    See Also:
    DefaultCritter

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class DefaultCritter

        radius, xCoord, xVelocity, yCoord, yVelocity

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Shooter(double xCoord, double yCoord, double xVelocity, double yVelocity, int lives, boolean isPlayerOne)
      Creates a shooter using the DefaultCritter class as a basis, also adds extra properties to the shooter to give the shooter a barrel that can move around with a radial velocity, and also gives the shooter the ability to obtain various power ups, with powerUpCounter specifying how many missiles of that power up type the shooter has left before his power up expires.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      double getAngleBarrel() 
      int getLives() 
      int getPower() 
      double getPowerUpCounter() 
      double getXCoordBarrel() 
      double getYCoordBarrel() 
      void move()
      Updates the shooters movement and ensures that the shooter stays within the bounds of the canvas, and ensures that the shooters barrel can't move below the horizontal.
      void removeLife() 
      void render()
      Renders the shooter on the canvas, if the shooter is player one then render it as blue, otherwise render the shooter as green
      void resetState(int startXCoord, int startYCoord)
      Resets the shooter to its initial state and position on the canvas in the beginning of each new round
      void setPowerUp(int powerUp)
      Receives an integer powerUp which specifies which type of powerup the shooter currently has, and gives the shooter a certain amount of those missiles (if applicable - powerUpCounter specifies how many missiles of a certain type the shooter has before the powerup expires), otherwise it increases the powerups lives if the shooter has gained an extra life.
      void setRadialVelocityBarrel(double radialVelocityBarrel)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Shooter

        public Shooter(double xCoord,
               double yCoord,
               double xVelocity,
               double yVelocity,
               int lives,
               boolean isPlayerOne)
        Creates a shooter using the DefaultCritter class as a basis, also adds extra properties to the shooter to give the shooter a barrel that can move around with a radial velocity, and also gives the shooter the ability to obtain various power ups, with powerUpCounter specifying how many missiles of that power up type the shooter has left before his power up expires. The initial power up of the shooter is set to a normal missile and its barrel points straight upwards at a 90 angle degree from the horizontal.
        Parameters:
        xCoord - the x coordinate of the shooter
        yCoord - the y coordinate of the shooter
        xVelocity - the x velocity of the shooter
        yVelocity - the y velocity of the shooter
        lives - the amount of lives assigned to the shooter
        isPlayerOne - a boolean variable representing whether or not the shooter is player one, used for when rendering the shooter to specify the shooters colour

    • Method Detail

      • setPowerUp

        public void setPowerUp(int powerUp)
        Receives an integer powerUp which specifies which type of powerup the shooter currently has, and gives the shooter a certain amount of those missiles (if applicable - powerUpCounter specifies how many missiles of a certain type the shooter has before the powerup expires), otherwise it increases the powerups lives if the shooter has gained an extra life.
        Parameters:
        powerUp - the current powerup that the shooter has obtained

      • setRadialVelocityBarrel

        public void setRadialVelocityBarrel(double radialVelocityBarrel)

        public void decreasePowerUpCounter()

        public double getAngleBarrel()

      • getYCoordBarrel

        public int getLives()

      • getPower

        public int getPower()

      • getPowerUpCounter

        public double getPowerUpCounter()

      • removeLife

        public void removeLife()

      • move

        public void move()
        Updates the shooters movement and ensures that the shooter stays within the bounds of the canvas, and ensures that the shooters barrel can't move below the horizontal.

      • render

        public void render()
        Renders the shooter on the canvas, if the shooter is player one then render it as blue, otherwise render the shooter as green

      • resetState

        public void resetState(int startXCoord,
                       int startYCoord)
        Resets the shooter to its initial state and position on the canvas in the beginning of each new round
        Parameters:
        startXCoord - the starting xCoord of the shooter
        startYCoord - the starting yCoord of the shooter
